title.name: Title
notes: default format is 'Drone Academy â€¢ Cyrus, Miley
other formats possible, as this is merely for display it's _data_ is elsewhere

_id.name: ID
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_owner.name: Owner
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_createdDate.name: Created Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_updatedDate.name: Updated Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

idST.name: Student Last
idST.usage: one of two Compound Keys (idCS the other)

studentDisplay.name: Student Name
notes: 'Last, First'

jsonStudent.name: Student Last
notes: as JSON this is almost inexhaustible
and all of the data is available through relational queries
and this can be changed and appended
but the idea is a subset of the data that is too much for individual fields, but handy for some tasks
it will be important to (eventually) have a mechanism to refresh this data regularly

idCS.name: Course ID
idCS.source: WiX Velo by way of 'Summer Courses'_id
idCS.usage: one of two Compound Keys (idST the other)
notes: idCS covers both 'Course' and 'Class' which are interchangeable

idQK.name: Quick Key ID
idQK.source: SteamDA to link FormStack and Course Table
idQK.usage: used as Primary key from FormStack to WiX
notes: because the 'true' _id was too long to show on FormStack confirmation Emails

jsonCourse.name: Course JSON
jsonCourse.source: SteamDA to link FormStack and Course Table
notes: because the 'true' _id was too long to show on FormStack confirmation Emails
in a sense this makes Family ID redundant, but still good to have Family ID so that it is its own thing
in geek talk, using the Family ID makes everything more 'extensible'
it is permissible, for this table, for this value to be 'INSTANTIATE'

idPP.name: Primary Parent ID
idPP.source: WiX Velo by way of automated Parent Membership
idPP.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: in a sense this makes Family ID redundant, but still good to have Family ID so that it is its own thing
in geek talk, using the Family ID makes everything more 'extensible'
it is permissible, for this table, for this value to be 'INSTANTIATE'

jsonCorollary.name: Corollary JSON
notes: for the same reasons every other table has 'jsonCorollary'
yet in this instance it is _highly_ likely not to be used
probably good to insert an empty JSON Object,'{}'
NOTE: this _could_ obviate both 'jsonStudent' and 'jsonCourse'
... fewer attributes & fatter fields, or more attributes & skinnier fields

jsonStatusNotes.name: Status Notes JSON
jsonStatusNotes.usage: discrete values to describe the status of the Enrollment
notes: since every Status is another element in this JSON, used for Attendance too
PRESENT
ATTENDANCE PRESENT
EXCUSED ABSENCE
UNEXCUSED ABSENCE
ATTENDANCE EXCUSED ABSENCE
ATTENDANCE UNEXCUSED ABSENCE
ENROLLED
--default--
COMPLETED
GRADUATED
PASSED
FAILED
WITHDRAWN
EXPELLED
